title: (x) Saint Pau Public School square sans - Agency {Ken Messenger}
content:
Does anybody recognize this face? I thought it looked like something from Emigre...

 [‹ The Oprah Magazine body copy serif face](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014103543/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37650 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Aco poster sans/serif combination - Baskerville, Akzidenz-Grotesk {Florian} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014103543/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37643 "Go to next forum topic")
author: mister_eaves

comments.content:
Oops, forgot the attachment. Here it is.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014103543im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/SPPS_4139.jpg)

\>\>Where is here?\<\<

Ahh, yes. A question I’ve been asking myself for some time. I’m hoping if I continue to read my Kahlil Gibran, I may discover the answer.

\> Ahh, yes. A question I’ve been asking myself for some time.

The image didn’t show in my browser, BECAUSE IT’S IN CMYK.  
Please don’t insert or attach images other than in RGB - PLEASE.

Oh, and yes that’s [Agency](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014103543/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/fb-agency/).

Oh, and that’s from Fontbureau, not Emigre.

\> Ahh, yes. A question I’ve been asking myself for some time.

The image didn’t show in my browser, BECAUSE IT’S IN CMYK.  
———————————————-  
Sorry, Jan, that was just supposed to be a joke, not a crack at you. I couldn’t see the image either.

Jason C

Read — da — friggin’ — FAQ, Mister Eaves. That’s why it yells [!!! PLEASE READ THIS FIRST !!! How to post a sample or image](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014103543/http:/typophile.com/node/18067) at you at the top of the list. :^P

\> Sorry, Jan, that was just supposed to be a joke, not a crack at you.  
\> I couldn’t see the image either.

I took it as a joke and I thought it was funny. Don’t worry ;-)
I thought Germans were too stoic to have a sense of humor. :D Just kidding. My entire family is from Germany: Beckers, Robenhorsts, Kleunkers, Brusses, Heideckers etc.

\> My entire family is from Germany

That’s where the umlaut comes from, eh?

Ja ist es, mein guter Mann.

Is that right?
